security_audit.summary: Scanned a single markdown file containing illustrative Python snippets. No file access, network calls, or execution logic is present. Content matches stated risk metric purpose.

content.user_title: Measure portfolio risk with core metrics
content.value_statement: You need consistent risk measurements across portfolios and time horizons. This skill provides clear formulas and workflows for VaR, drawdowns, and risk adjusted ratios.
actual_capabilities: Compute volatility, downside deviation, and beta from returns
Calculate historical and parametric VaR plus CVaR
Generate drawdown series and maximum drawdown
Produce Sharpe, Sortino, Calmar, and Omega ratios
Provide portfolio risk parity and diversification metrics
limitations: Requires return series input and does not fetch market data
Assumes daily trading day count of 252 unless adjusted
Parametric VaR assumes normality without distribution tests
No transaction cost or liquidity modeling

use_cases.title: Risk reporting pack
use_cases.description: Build a consistent risk summary for weekly portfolio reviews.

use_cases.title: Risk model prototyping
use_cases.description: Prototype VaR, CVaR, and drawdown metrics for new strategies.

use_cases.title: Limit monitoring
use_cases.description: Define risk limits and monitor breaches across portfolios.

prompt_templates.title: Basic risk summary
prompt_templates.prompt: Calculate annual volatility, max drawdown, and Sharpe ratio from this daily return series.

prompt_templates.title: VaR and CVaR
prompt_templates.prompt: Compute historical VaR 95 and CVaR 95 for the provided returns and explain the results.

prompt_templates.title: Portfolio risk split
prompt_templates.prompt: Using these asset returns and weights, compute portfolio volatility and component risk contributions.

prompt_templates.title: Rolling risk view
prompt_templates.prompt: Create 63 day rolling volatility and rolling VaR 95 for this return series.

output_examples.input: Summarize risk for my strategy using daily returns.

best_practices: Use multiple metrics to capture tail risk and drawdowns
Align time horizon with your trading and reporting cadence
Document assumptions such as distribution and lookback window
anti_patterns: Relying only on VaR without CVaR or drawdowns
Using very short lookbacks that ignore regime changes
Ignoring benchmark choice when computing information ratio

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill is plain text guidance and works across these platforms.

faq.question: What data limits should I expect?
faq.answer: You must supply return series; no data fetching is included.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my risk pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, adapt the provided classes into your existing Python workflow.

faq.question: Does it access or store sensitive data?
faq.answer: No, it does not read files or send data anywhere.

faq.question: What if results look wrong?
faq.answer: Check return frequency, missing values, and the annualization factor.

faq.question: How does this compare to a full risk platform?
faq.answer: It is a lightweight reference, not a full featured risk system.
